channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Verges need cutting low down, 8th August
item.description:
The verges are becoming hedges in this village from the beginning and exit to the area there becomes no where to Stand when a car passes also this is hard hedges and is scuffing sides of cars when driving here could the council not come and cut low down please this hasn’t been done in years and used to be maintained as I have also stressed the hedges are overhanging into the lane where they are not cut at appropriate times
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Lane, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is always a large amount of water at this junction, 8th August
item.description:
If you come from the GCHQ roundabout on the Gloucester Road and turn first left into Badgeworth Road there is always a lot of water,obviously escaping from somewhere.(just opposite a builders entrance)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Drain is blocked causing water to be going all over the road and pavement, 8th August
item.description:
The drain opposite Briarfields Motel & Touring Caravan Park, Gloucester Road (B4063), Cheltenham, Gloucestershire, GL51 0SX is blocked. Water is spewing all over the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Disabled bay and zigzag lines worn, need repainting. When people park in the disabled bay they say it’s hard to read the writing as it’s worn., 8th August
item.description:
Disabled bay opposite Innsworth infant school and zigzag lines outside the school gates.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Luke Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Multiple potholes, 7th August
item.description:
On the bend both heading both up and down the sides of Harp Hill just before the right turn for Camp Road the road is just getting beyond a joke now. It is impossible to avoid and is causing damage to vehicles. It is only a matter of time before there is a head-on collision as cars swerve to avoid and cross the central line.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing 30mph sign on zoons link road., 7th August
item.description:
Hi, is there a plan to replace the missing 30mph sign on the Zoons link road to Brockworth ? The one on the right used to be there, but now it's just one or two bare poles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: The overgrown brambles are pushing the fence down. The fence cannot be replaced until the brambles on public land are removed. The fence urgently needs to be replaced for security reasons due to the back garden backing onto the B4063., 7th August
item.description:
The overgrown brambles are pushing the fence down. The fence cannot be replaced until the brambles on public land are removed. The fence urgently needs to be replaced for security reasons due to the back garden backing onto the B4063.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway outside sainsburys, 7th August
item.description:
The pathway outside sainsburys has a damaged drain, a hole from where a parking restrictions sign was and the pavement is really uneven making it nearly impossible to pull the delivery in at the minute. The hole in the path and drain cover are dangerous for all pedestrians
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 146, Bath Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW10 Potholes problem, 7th August
item.description:
28DAY STATS REQUIRED CW POTHOLE AROUND IRONWORKS APPROX 1200 X 200 X 40MM 2 WAY TRAFFIC LIGHTS TM NR BEND (CW10 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 7th August
item.description:
Customer reports that there is a significant number of developers signage in this area. Is concerned that they are blocking visibility near the junction, and also appear to be unsecured (no sandbags). There are also a lot of temp signage attached to the street furniture, with some falling off.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Update on deep pothole - FixMyStreet ref: 7989551., 7th August
item.description:
FixMyStreet ref: 7989551. I reported this yesterday evening and the problem is getting worse. The depth of the hole is probably about 16 inches. The width has increased a little. It is worryingly close to the drain, the path / pavement and the cottages.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -FW6 Potholes problem, 7th August
item.description:
Stats Required FW Abrupt Level Difference Reset/ Remove Block Paving Brick 200 x 100 x 20mm Marked as a dot Standard TM - Footway Closure - Alternative Footway Available (FW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet
